The above text resulted in me getting a 10 game chat suspension.  What you don't see, and what I'm responding to (in perhaps a snarky but not necessarily toxic manner imo), is two of my teammates cursing at me pretty much the entire time.  I know that I shouldn't have responded at all, and that's on me but I'm having a hard time understanding how in the world this resulted in a 10 game chat restriction after one game.  Thanks for any feedback.

replies.body:
well the problem with riots feedback system is that it only shows up to 3 games of chatlogs.
you can be a tiny bit toxic for 100 games. just in such little amounts that even after 100 games you arent punished. but then you get punished. and it might only show you 1 game of chatlog.

the system (which is automated) cant and doesnt consider context. never type back.

you kinda said the game is lost and called people out for losing and flaming. 2 things the system doesnt like.

hope that helps you

Thanks for your take on this.  I can tell you right now that if this what's qualified as toxic, then there were perhaps 2 games where this kind of back and forth occurred. Certainly not 100 games, for sure. I know that I don't have any evidence, but most of the time I have chat totally muted.  This just feels like being stopped for speeding and being shot instead of being asked to show my license and registration lol
considering it takes quite a lot to get the first punishement (the 10 games CR) maybe you can write the support and get some more insight.

The bot compiles the words you use that it tags every time you're reported. As you use the same words repeatedly, the system puts a higher value on those triggers every time it processes a report against you. Once your toxicity value reaches a certain point and you have enough (edit: reported) games in a variable window of time (dependant on the toxicity value), the bot triggers.

This means that your opinion of how toxic you were does not matter. You triggered the system.

The system expects that you STOP BEING NEGATIVE and REFRAIN FROM USING ANY TRIGGERS. You could do this by simply never chatting. I advise doing exactly the above instead.

It's actually easy to do. Remember that people get mad easily and you should only say things that contribute to better gaming.

Thanks for your input. I understand what you're saying,  but I've used chat in maybe 4 games total, and while what you're saying makes sense, I don't think it's what's going on here. I've submitted a ticket to try to get some clarity on this, thanks for your feedback!
If your other 3 games looked like that, that would trigger it. Remember the representative is only there to clarify why you got the suspension, not to discuss how valid you feel the punishment was.

How does a robot pick any of this up? Does it have these specific combinations of words in its database even though the words on their own are not swearing? It is a stretch but "ff" can be said in "let's make them ff" "the command to surrender is /ff", "Just end" when you aced enemy and your team wants to do Nash instead of nexus, 'how do I _report_ a bug?" . Same for done, lost, fed etc... If so, how many games like that does it take to be punished? He did not even beg to report his team, technically.
In addition to Arammus's contribution, punishment is based on severity/time. With new accounts the 'time' is really small, so it's much easier to reach the punishment threshold.
Yeah, their rules are super strict. Even passive aggression and negative attitude can result in a punishment, which is what we have here.
